critique: This document is an executive order that allows an individual to be appointed to a position without following civil service rules. This could be seen as a slight expansion of executive power, but it is also a specific case and does not necessarily indicate a broader trend. The order is recommended by the Secretary of the Treasury, suggesting some level of oversight. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion.
